description: From French oligarque, olygarche, from Late Latin oligarcha, from Ancient Greek ὀλιγάρχης (oligárkhēs). By surface analysis, olig- (“few”) +‎ -arch (“ruler, leader”).

entries.meaning: A member of an oligarchy; someone who is part of a small group that runs a country.
A very wealthy business owner who wields political power.
(cosmogony) A protoplanet formed during oligarchic accretion.
examples: In the inner Solar System, only the asteroid Ceres was able to grow fast enough to become a dwarf planet, but in the outer Solar System huge numbers of icy bodies formed, ranging from pebbles to the oligarchs now recognized as dwarf planets.
